text: The Men's 60 metres event at the 2005 European Athletics Indoor Championships was held on March 4–5. ==Medalists== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:left" |- align="center" | width=200 bgcolor=gold|Gold||width=200 bgcolor=silver|Silver|| width=200 bgcolor=CC9966|Bronze |- |Jason Gardener '''' |Ronald Pognon '''' |Kostyantyn Vasyukov '''' |} Note: Mark Lewis-Francis originally finished second but was later stripped off his medal for the use of cannabis. ==Results== ===Heats=== First 3 of each heat (Q) and the next 4 fastest (q) qualified for the semifinals. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !!
